definition: to call the wind and summon the rain (idiom); to exercise magical powers/fig. to stir up troubles
to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale
variant of 呼[hu1]/to shout/to call out
wind/news/style/custom/manner/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],絲|丝[si1]
to call
to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet
rain/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],場|场[chang2]

sentences.english: I have also been brilliant in the flat g summon wind and rain.
sentences.chinese: 我也辉煌过，在单位前呼后拥，呼风唤雨。

sentences.english: It is said to rule the rivers and seas and dominate the clouds and rains.
sentences.chinese: 据说龙掌管着河流大海，能呼风唤雨。

sentences.english: Those pearls have supernatural power which can make your dreams cone true.
sentences.chinese: 宝珠有神奇力量，可以呼风唤雨，随心所欲。

sentences.english: You know, I used to walk tall around here .
sentences.chinese: 你知道，我以前在这里呼风唤雨。

definition: to exercise sole hegemony (idiom); to dominate a whole area (market, resources etc)/to hold as one's personal fiefdom
lit. to hide the sky with one hand/to hide the truth from the masses
lit. to rebuke Heaven and Earth (idiom); fig. shaking the whole world/all-powerful
like a fish back in water (idiom); glad to be back in one's proper surroundings
to produce clouds with one turn of the hand and rain with another (idiom); fig. to shift one's ground/tricky and inconstant/to make love
to oppress/to rule as a despot/to tyrannize
to possess great magical power/to possess remarkable abilities
lit. to upend heaven and earth (idiom)/fig. to change the course of events/to turn things around
long sleeves help one dance beautifully (idiom); money and power will help you in any occupation
to be successful in every endeavor
to incite trouble/to stir up havoc
to be popular/to be getting on well/much in demand
omnipotent
the man (or woman) of the moment (idiom)/influential figure
(politics) strongman/(in the workplace, esp. of a woman) a highly capable person/(old) robber
to consider oneself unexcelled in the world/to be insufferably arrogant
